page.title: 19STEPHEN GELLY FARM
page.content: The owner of Stephen Gelly farm is Mr. David Collinge. He is a beef and dairy farmer with 53 cows and 70 bullocks. He owns 105 acres of land and rents 22 acres. All the land is permanent pasture for feeding the animals. Mr. Collinge is a conservationist. He does not want to alter his farm or fields on a bank behind the house, which is called "Badger Hill", with 10-15 badgers living there. Badgers have lived there for over 200 years. There are also 2 families of foxes and many rabbits living on the farmland. The name Stephen Gelly comes from the Cornish-Stuman (incline) and Kelly (a little wood).
